title: Third Conditionals for Past Regrets
objectives: Understand Conditionals Third at Beginner level
Apply Conditionals Third in real conversations

vocabulary.example: If I had studied, I would have passed.
She had left before I arrived.
They would have come if invited.
I regret not going to the party.

vocabulary.definition: verb tense for actions before another past event

content.introduction: Welcome to this lesson on Conditionals Third.
content.explanation: In this lesson, you will learn about Conditionals Third at the Beginner level.
tips: Practice Conditionals Third daily for best results.

exercises.question: Choose the correct sentence: a) If I had seen her, I would have spoken. b) If I saw her, I would have spoken.
If he ____ (know) about the meeting, he would have attended.
Talk about something you wish you had done last year.

culturalNote: Third conditionals are used in American English to express regret or reflect on past mistakes and missed opportunities.
